means: 把（如山坡或坡地）修成梯田

word_mean: 为了保持水土，发展农、林、牧业生产，将坡地改造成台阶式或波浪式断面的田地。

sentence.Network_en: A flight of stone steps leads to the terrace.
Nervously clutching our glasses of chilled wine, we gathered on the terrace.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们聚集在露台上,手里紧张地握着盛有冰镇葡萄酒的酒杯.

sentence.Network_en: Single room in lovely flat, roof terrace, non-smoking prof., woman pref.
sentence.Network_cn: 舒适公寓中的单间，带屋顶阳台，不抽烟的职业人士，女士优先。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (denoting an open gallery, later a platform or balcony in a theatre): from Old French, literally 'rubble, platform', based on Latin terra 'earth'

entry.tran: 排屋(指相互连接、式样相似的房屋)
entry.def: A terrace is a row of similar houses joined together by their side walls.

example.tran: 一排雅致的维多利亚风格的房屋

entry.def: A terrace is a flat area of stone or grass next to a building where people can sit.

example.ex: Some guests recline in lounge chairs on the sea-facing terrace.
example.tran: 在面向大海的平台上一些客人斜躺在躺椅上。

entry.def: Terraces are a series of flat areas built like steps on the side of a hill so that crops can be grown there.

example.ex: ...massive terraces of maize and millet carved into the mountainside like giant steps.
example.tran: 山坡上开垦出的像巨型台阶一样的大块大块梯田，上面种着玉米和小米

entry.tran: (足球赛观众可站立的)阶梯看台
entry.def: The terraces at a football ground are wide steps that people can stand on when they are watching a game.

means.word_mean: 1. usually paved outdoor area adjoining a residence
2. a level shelf of land interrupting a declivity (with steep slopes above and below)
3. a row of houses built in a similar style and having common dividing walls (or the street on which they face);
2. make into terraces as for cultivation;

auth_sentence.content: It is a private terrace hidden from public view.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is a private terrace hidden from public view.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is a private terrace hidden from public view.

auth_sentence.content: The scattered terrace and balcony areas have wonderful views.
auth_sentence.res_content: The scattered terrace and balcony areas have wonderful views.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The scattered terrace and balcony areas have wonderful views.

auth_sentence.content: God forbid it should be described as an end-of-terrace.
auth_sentence.res_content: God forbid it should be described as an end-of-terrace.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: God forbid it should be described as an end-of-terrace.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =earth,表示"土地"; 2. =frighten,可怕,恐惧; 3. =frighten,表示"恐,怕"

stems_affixes.value_cn: [comeing from]地球外的, 宇宙的[outside the earth]
stems_affixes.word_buile: extra外+terrestrial[adj.地球的，地球上的]→adj.[comeing from]地球外的, 宇宙的[outside the earth]
mediterranean而来→n.地中海 adj.地中海的
subterrane[n.下层; 洞穴, 地下室]+ean→adj.地下的
terr土地+estrial→adj.地球的，地球上的
territory[n.领土;版图;领域,范围]+ial……的→territorial领土的
deter[v.威慑,吓住]+ent……的→deterrent威慑的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 很糟的;可怕的,骇人的;极度的,厉害的
stems_affixes.word_buile: terr恐,怕+ible可..的→可怕的
terr恐,怕+ific产生……的→带来可怕→好到让人可怕的地步→极好的
extra外+territorial[adj.领土的,土地的,地方的]+ity表名词→n.治外法权
mediterranean而来→n.地中海 adj.地中海的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 下层; 洞穴, 地下室
stems_affixes.word_buile: sub下面+terr土地+ane→n.下层; 洞穴, 地下室
terr土地+ace→n.平台,阳台,露台
terr土地+ain表名词→n.地势,地形
terr土地+it+ory场所,范围→地的范围,领土
deter[v.威慑,吓住]+ment表名词→n.制止

stems_affixes.value_cn: 恐怖, 可怕的人, 恐怖时期, 恐怖行动
stems_affixes.word_buile: terr恐,怕+or表名词→n.恐怖, 可怕的人, 恐怖时期, 恐怖行动
terror恐怖+ist人→n.恐怖分子
dis离,出+inter埋→v.挖出,掘土
in进+ter=terr土地→v.埋葬
de去+ter=terr恐,怕→吓跑了,吓得不动了
terr恐,怕+ify使……→v.使害怕,使惊恐

sentences.en: The people here grow rice on terraces.
sentences.cn: 此地的人们在梯田里种植水稻。

jushi.english: The people here grow rice on terraces.
jushi.chinese: 此地的人们在梯田里种植水稻。

jushi.english: She wandered out onto the terrace.
The hillsides had been terraced and planted with lemon tress.
jushi.chinese: 山坡上修了梯田，种上了柠檬树。
